intro: Anchusa konyaensis, commonly known as Konya bellflower, is a flowering plant native to Turkey. It belongs to the Boraginaceae family and is characterized by its blue or purple flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or dry habitats, showcasing its adaptability to arid environments. Anchusa konyaensis has hairy stems and lance-shaped leaves, which help reduce water loss. It is often found in open areas such as grasslands and slopes, contributing to local biodiversity.
